Description: Body sherd of Attic red-figured pottery bell-krater with turn to neck; interior glazed black with reserved band and streaky below; exterior: reserved band at junction of rim and body; below, red-figure decoration consisting of woman (face, top of head, neck, right shoulder and right hand remaining, wearing wreath, earring and necklace, all in added, and embroidered peplos), looking to left and holding a necklace with white beads in her right hand; relief-contour for face and hand.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0204) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain Fasc. 3, Oxford Fasc. 1 (p. 46, pl. L, no. 20)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
